The subtitels have to be in the same directory as the movie and have to be called exactly the same name.
Wow, a sudden interest in his work now that he is dead.  I am glad people are finally watching this so many years after I have uploaded it.

If you just want the swedish sound, you can do this:

1. Download virtualdubmod, for free here:

http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=65889

2. Run it, drag the movie into it.

3. Go to "Video" then "Direct Stream Copy"

4. Go to "Steams" then "Streams list"

5. Select the second one, then click "Disable" then click "ok"

6. Go to "File" then "save as" then put in a new name like "New Movie" then click ok.

It will then output the movie with only the swedish track, and you can use your favorite player without hearing both tracks at once.

Don't forget to delete the subtitle files also.  Also, if at any time virtualdubmod warns you about an mp3 header, just click "No".

Hope this helps.

If anyone else (like me) has trouble getting the .sub subtitles to work, just go to allsubs.org search for "seventh seal" and you'll find some in .srt format, then just put them in the original movie folder, and make the file names match. worked for me.
